Articles.Content:
Steam downloaded a new up date.

It eraised all my contracts. I was just fueling the Duna mission at Minimus. 

It will need a complete refit.

I have put it down to some sort of coup on Kerbil..... 

I hope it does not happen again.
I wouldn't place the blame on an update necessarily. I've had my contracts wiped out of the blue before.
Still 1.0.2 in the Store. It looks like your copy of the game glitched on you.

I've also had contracts disappear. 

I guess I didn't think too much of it, since i took them more for the down payments (which I really needed), and those stayed ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
Same, I had to copy-paste my contracts from earlier saves several times already. I know it happens while playing, even if you don't quickload at all.
Wait, 1.0.3 is out? It's still 1.0.2 for me.

> 
> Wait, 1.0.3 is out? It's still 1.0.2 for me.

Yes of course there's a an update with nobody on the forum talking about it and absolutely no devblog or changelog.

It's just done it again mid play....

Any ideas to stop it?

two ways to stop it i found one is a sure fire. go to steam/steamapps/common/ copy your KSP file to another location completely devoid of steam, then open said ksp folder. send the launcher to desktop as a shortcut, and use that from now on. or disable steam's automatic updates for KSP (which may or may not work.)
Hmmm...I don't even have the steam version.
i bought it on steam but i run it as my previous post. 3 different instals including steam. steam is my vanilla sandbox then i have two different instals. on is RO one is not.
No updates have been pushed for KSP recently, so if anything is broken in this case it's Steam ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Yes of course there's a an update with nobody on the forum talking about it and absolutely no devblog or changelog.

I thought it could have updated like 3 seconds before OP started his thread. D:

> 
> It's just done it again mid play....
> Any ideas to stop it?

Steam may have noticed a missing or broken file (the repair download is indistinguishable from update downloads IIRC correctly)

Strange it happened mid-play -> Never know steam to do any updating/repairing to a game while it is running (launched through steam), it will wait until the game is closed.

You can turn auto-update off for the game in steam by right clicking it in the game list in your library if you suspect steam is at fault; else I think you can copy the whole folder KSP from Steam\Steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program to else where and run that copy of it

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T15:05:29Z" title="06/19/2015 03:05  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Dilli**

This is why I use the non-steam version.

I have rarely if ever experienced loss of data, FWIW.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/72212-Jebretary-Automatic-Version-Control-%28backups%29-for-craft-and-saves-v0-4-0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/72212-Jebretary-Automatic-Version-Control-%28backups%29-for-craft-and-saves-v0-4-0)
